direction.raw_text: `EM UP! The Kid jumps back startled and throws his hands up.       The cops share a laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Put your hands dawn. What do you got in the bag?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something for my Pops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see. Well, your Pops has been making you carry around drugs for him. We're going to have to take them. The Kid hesitates for a second before handing the knapsack over. Rottovich opens it and pulls out TWO BRICKS OF HEROIN, wrapped in plastic. He nods to Sobozinski. The Kid stays rooted right where he is, looking up at the Detectives like a lost puppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Pops is going to be mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give the kid a twenty. Sobozinski fishes in his pocket starts to peel off bills for the kid who then sprints away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the world coming to? Everybody's on the friggin' take... Rottovich and Sobozinski head off with the knapsack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. - BACK-NIGHT (PRESENT) Butch and Jake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keeping the Fix happy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never know when you can use a crooked cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep going. I want to know how you got Lionel Dolby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you want to know how to play the Big Con.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this case, you might say I want to know how not to play the Big Con. Butch shoves the gun a little harder into Jake's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- BAR- NIGHT A trendy bar, dimly lit and packed. We PAN along the hip crowd and STOP on Jake speaking with a SLICK GUY dressed in black Armani.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First thing about being on the grift.... You're only as good as your Mark. The Roper's the guy who finds them. Jake buys another round to the indifferent Slick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all have money one way or another. Some of them come from money. THE SCENE DOESN'T CHANGE--- Slick MORPHS into a FAT TEXAS BUSINESS MAN wearing a ten-gallon hat. He doesn't smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's that saying-- Show me an honest man and I'll show you a natural born liar. There's always that little bit of bad no matter how much good. It's that little itch on the back of you neck. You may not even know it's there, but it is. The Fat Texan MORPHS into a WALL STREET-type suit, who remains stoic as Jake reaches over for another round of drinks. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A good Roper knows how to scratch it-- You the outdoorsy-type? "I was just fly fishing out in Montana". You play the market? "I just got a tip on a tech start-up IPO." You saw "the 'Riverdance" twice? "I had a roommate in college who was gay." Whatever... Wall Street MORPHS into a THIN EURO-TRASH man who takes a drink from Jake without even a "thanks."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means that in fifteen minutes we're on good terms. Thirty, I'm your buddy. Euro-Trash MORPHS into an distinguished looking OLDER MAN as he takes a sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In an hour, I'm your best friend. Jake punctuates some unheard point with a slap on his knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a day and you'll let me do your wife and daughter at the same time. It's too late for you... Jake looks up as the OLDER MAN MORPHS into LIONEL DOLBY, the nervous mark from the earlier con.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have your confidence. CLOSE-UP: Dolby's lips loosen in a wide SMILE. Jake smiles back. He puts his drink down, then takes the drink from Dolby. They remain talking as THE BACKGROUND-- MORPHS INTO: EXT. - SIDEWALK-NIGHT Under the light of a streetlamp, the two continue to talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you the "Tale"-- It's the story of how we're going to make easy money. No one gets hurt. And here's the guy who's going to help. That's when you meet the Insideman. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Gordo approaches, dressed in a suit and looking slightly anxious. Introductions are made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Insideman's the one with the know- How, the scoop, the angle. But maybe 'you' re the suspicious type . So I give you the "Convincer." We both put up a little and we get a little back. Just a taste. Gordo pulls an envelope out of his coat and gives it to Dolby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just enough that when I tell you we can make more off of it, you agree. Jake speaks quickly to Dolby who nods emphatically.    He hands the envelope back to Gordo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That`s when I put you on the "Send." You put in -a little, you got a little. Put in a lot... I "send" you out for mare.  As much as you can get.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. - JAKE'S APARTMENT- NIGHT Jake stands TALKING DIRECTLY TO CAMERA, loading a big, black revolver with bullets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't matter what the con is. Insider trading, a line we got on   a bookie club, insurance scam, whatever... You saw the money and you want it. More of it. Who cares   if you have to bend the rules a little?  As long as no one gets hurt. Jake spins the gun cylinder then SLAPS it closed, pointing it straight at the CAMERA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then someone does... BLAM!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 30. INT. - THE EUGLID BAR- NIGHT A flash of Gordo's stunned face before his chest EXPLODES IN RED. Jake stands holding the smoking gun.   Dolby looks around in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns 'to face CAMERA) Frankie Suits always said, that what you have to understand about any confidence game, is that it's like putting on a play where everyone knows their part... The Roper, the Insideman, the Shills... Everyone except for the Mark. Gordo lying in a pool of blood...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (while playing dead) I've been shot. Oh. The humanity. Big Al sits cowering at a table...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (monotone) God. No. Please.     Don't kill me. Miles casually washing glasses...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indifferent) You better hurry. The police will be here any second. (breaking character) I don't really understand my motivation with this. Why am I washing glasses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still facing camera) Now you're an accomplice in a homicide. Everything you thought you were in control of just flew out the window or is dripping down your leg. Dolby turns to Jake, eyes wide, lips trembling in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to Dolby) You should be running out the door, desperate to forget this ever happened, ready to repent your greedy ways! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Dolby eyes the briefcases of money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about... The money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns back to CAMERA) Then there it is again... That little itch. There's a guy holding a smoking gun, a guy bleeding all over the floor and still, all you can think about is the money. You twisted fuck. So we gotta give you the "Blow-off". We make sure that you never, ever want to look for us again. We get you off our backs. Forever. Jake stops for a second and listens... He points over his shoulder and on cue A POLICE SIREN WAILS in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's why you need the "Fix"... Dolby bolts for the door without the money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.- SIDEWALK- CONTINUOUS Dolby tries to act casual as he walks away. CUT TO: INT. - THE EUCLID BAR- CONTINUOUS Rottovich and Sabozinski enter the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The New York Police Department's finest. Half as smart and twice as crooked as the guy they just chased away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT - BACK ALLEY- NIGHT (PRESENT) Butch eases the gun off Jake's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how'd you get caught? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suits used to say that in any con, sooner or later someone's going to start asking the right questions. Usually, it takes a little longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- JAKE'S APARPMENT--NIGHT Empty except for Gordo, Miles, Jake and Lupus, dressed in another of his trademark loud sweatsuits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're working for the King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re: Lupus) Wait a second... Who's the mope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the King's eyes and ears.   Just in case you decide to get cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we gotta short con our way out of a hundred and fifty grand? That could only take like, a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Big con. One rag. One rag and we get out from under all this. But we need another Shill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we need another Shill for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT . - WAX--NIGHT A crowded night... LILY, the attractive blonde from earlier, flirts with a well dressed, OLDER MAN who has his hand firmly planted on her ass. She squeezes his hand and gives him a quick peck on the cheek before walking away. She takes a look at the man's wallet she just lifted before putting it in her bag. From out of nowhere, Jake bumps into her. (CONTINUED) 33. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (not so innocently) Oops. Jake takes her by the arm out to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.- ALLEY/OUTSIDE BAR- NIGHT Jake pushes Lily through the back door where she finds Gordo, Miles and Lupus waiting. Her once flirtatious demeanor is replaced by something harder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this? You guys cops or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not cops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta be kidding me.       Her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, her.    Where's my wallet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your what? Jake takes her bag and dumps the contents on the floor-- A few wallets, a watch, even a wedding ring. Jake picks up one of the wallets filled with cash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pocketing the wallet) You interested in a little work? Lily scoops up her bag and finds a cigarette, eyeing them all suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about your wallet, but if you think I'm going to suck dick over thirty seven dollars, a waxed out Visa and a bad fake I.D., you're fucking crazy. (lighting the cigarette) Jake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a deep breath and count to ten. It's not that kind of work. You're Lily, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Says who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're working Daffy's block. He was going to break your kneecaps. Pick- pockets can be so bitchy sometimes. I told him you were with us, so that's two you owe me. Lily takes a second to look the guys over. Miles gives her a wink. Lily slowly raises her middle finger at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have work. It pays a lot. Unless you figure on getting rich lifting wallets while old guys feel you up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooh. Sassy. What do you care who feels me up, Jake? Unless it kinda gotcha going. Did it, Jake? Getcha going? Lily saunters to Jake with a seductive grin. Jake may be aware that he's stopped breathing. She puts her hands on Jake's chest and leans in a half inch more, her lips an eyelash away from his. She whispers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep the wallet. We're even. Take a deep breath... Count to ten... And go fuck yourself. Lily pushes past Jake and heads out of the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it just me or is there something really hot about a girl telling you to go fuck yourself? Gordo gives Jake a nod of approval and Jake takes off after Lily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 35. EXT.- CITY SIDEWALK- NIGHT Lily down the street, Jake giving chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright!   Hold up.    You win.   You got the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee thanks. Now I don't have to find that bridge to jump off. Jake catches up and blocks Lily's way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had to see what your deal was.      I'm just a little superstitious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's my deal-- Don't waste my time. What do you want me for anyway? You don't even know me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just have a good feeling about you. Haven't you ever had someone say they had a good feeling about you before? Lily studies Jake's face for any hint of sarcasm.      None.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (beat) What's my cut?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get an equal cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I have to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just play a part.     A little acting. Lily steps back and hails a cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a wish. She points to a large digital clock hanging in a store window reading "11:11p".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven-eleven. If you're superstitious, make a wish. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Lily hops into the Cab and tosses Jake's new wallet onto the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's twice. The cab pulls away. Jake looks up at the clock-- "11:12P".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. - BACK ALLEY- NIGHT (PRESENT) Butch smiles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see why you liked her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was it. We had our crew.    Now we needed the Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- THE EUCLID- DAY Jake stands in front of the crew: Miles, Gordo, Lily and Lupus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morgan Gillette. Gordo and Miles both do their best to contain their disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because that's who the King Fin wants us to fleece. And Gillette's perfect...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- CITY BANK OF MANHATTAN/BOARDROOM--DAY A circle of BUSINESS MEN sitting at a conference table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His grandfather used to run liquor during prohibition and his father made a bundle in illegal importing and exporting. That makes him a third generation crook. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been tied into pretty much everything; drugs, mob, money rinsing... We PAN AROUND THE TABLE OF BUSINESS MEN and settle on MORGAN GILLETTE, a man in his early fifties with the sharp, angular features of a reptile. We STAY with Morgan as the meeting breaks and everyone heads for the door and into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. - CITY BANK OF MANHATTAN/HALLWAY-DAY Gillette is greeted by a handful of SUITS.       Butch is with them, staying in the periphery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a story going around that he helped fund the Contras back in the eighties. Gillette and his crew head through a large glass revolving door to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.- CITY BANK OF MANHATTAN- DAY A busy mid-day New York sidewalk.       Gillette heads towards a waiting Town Car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of his money's clean. A lot of it isn't. The best part is that we know exactly where it is. As Gillette and his crew disappear into the car, we PAN up to see the front of the building which has a large sign reading, "City Bank of Manhattan; A Gillette Family Company."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- THE EUCLID-- RESUMING Jake looks over the crew, who are less than convinced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much we going after?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two million. Miles lets out a whistle. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We only owe the King a hundred and fifty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We get fifty percent.   And we get clear of the King. Jake looks over at Lupus for confirmation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's worth it right there. You ask me, I don't think you can do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with Jack LaLane.   That guy's untouchable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why we don't go after him directly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- CITY BANK OF MANHATTAN/LOBBY Empty. The marble floor spotless, the dark oak teller windows vacant, a row of desks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We find a doable guy in Gillette's bank... Someone about mid-level. Not too high, not too low. A lone man, GRANT ASHBY, MATERIALIZES behind a desk on the empty floor and sits behind a computer terminal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We meet him with corporate papers, inquiring about a corporate loan for start up capital. The corporate papers are in order, but we need things to happen fast. Our guy fudges numbers in the right places, moves our papers to the top of the pile or to the bottom, depending upon what we need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that?    He works for Gillette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pay better. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: An envelope stuffed with cash MATERIALIZES on the desk next to Ashby. CUT TO: EXT . -- CAYMEN ISLANDS--DAY Crystal clear water gently rolls onto a white beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our guy gets us approved for the start up capital. But, the money can't be transferred to any one person. On the given day, the money's wired into a corporate account in an off-shore bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- GRAND CAYMEN'S BANK- DAY Another empty bank... A lone TELLER MATERIALIZES behind the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That same day, I show up in the Caymens with the proper I.D. and corporate papers to make a withdrawal. Jake MATERIALIZES on the empty bank floor, walking confidently up to the Teller with a SILVER BRIEFCASE in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just thinking out loud here, but... Two million in a briefcase?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good point. Jake approaches the Teller, now wheeling a BLACK SUITCASE behind him by the handle. Jake presents the Teller with a series of papers and a photo I.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's bank policy not to release this money in cash because it's under a corporate account. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The Teller turns to a computer printer and removes a check. Jake signs a few documents and places the check into his pocket. CUT TO: EXT.- CAYMEN ISLANDS/STREET--DAY Lined with shops and stores, but it's as empty as the bank. Not even a car: Jake strides out of the Grand Caymen's Bank and walks across the street to another building with a sign reading "BANK OF THE GRAND CAYMENS." CUT TO: INT.- BANK OF THE GRAND CAYMENS- DAY Again, empty... Jake strides in and approaches the deserted teller counter. ANOTHER TELLER MATERIALIZES and greets him with a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we cash the check at another bank. Jake slides the suitcase and the check over to the Teller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- JFK AIRPORT/TERMINAL HALLWAY- DAY Like the banks, empty. Jake walks with the suitcase down the flourescent lit hall towards a series of tables under a sign marked "Customs."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, this is the most important part-- You can't just walk into the United States with a suitcase full of cash without evoking the words "cavity search". As we get closer to the Custom's Desk, a CUSTOMS OFFICER wearing a white short sleeve shirt and a badge MATERIALIZES behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why you need someone on the inside at Customs. Jake approaches and slides the suitcase towards him. The Officer slides it back to Jake, revealing another envelope stuffed with cash under it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The Officer literally looks the other way as he pockets the envelope and waves Jake through the gate. CUT TO: EXT.- JFK AIRPORT- DAY Jake exits the terminal. Outside, the street is empty, not a traveler, an airlines rep, a luggage handler or a cab. Jake waits at an empty cross walk until the "walk" signal is given.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we disappear. As he walks away, WE SEE some PEOPLE MATERIALIZE carrying luggage... Then a FEW CARS... Then an AIRLINE REP... Gradually more and more people and cars, each MATERIALIZING into a normal scene at the airport until we lose Jake in the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- THE EUCLID- RESUMING Jake stops and gauges the crew for their reactions, which are the same all the way around-- Slack jawed disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (breaking the silence) This might just be me, but that is hands down, the dumbest fucking idea I've ever heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People have tried this before, Jake. It's never worked. Teddy Fraiser and his crew went on vacation in Chicago for it. Last year, Mumps got pinched in L.A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It never worked before because A, they didn't flush the bank enough; B, their corporate papers were for shit; C, they didn't have someone on the inside with Customs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, or D, it's a dumb fucking idea...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what do you want to do, Miles? Run? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We never had a problem with that before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well we never had this kind of problem before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? Yes we have. And we would have been beautiful about it. We would've had a bucket of chicken delivered to the King with a nice kiss my ass card attached to it. Then we woulda moved on `til the next local putz caught on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're getting a little old for running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well we're still a little young for Albany State Prison. Are you pissed about Al? I'm pissed too, but I' m not like "twenty-five to life" pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting clear of this. If you're not going to do it for the fucking principle, do it for the money. Gordo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Whatever, Jake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not "whatever." You're either in or you' re out. A silence falls over everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in. Her eyes stay on Jake as a smile grows across her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.- PAY PHONE- DAY Jake dials a number...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agreed with Miles. It was, hands down, a dumb fucking idea. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they bought it. Now I had to deliver and I needed help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it's Jake. How'd that tip work out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. BACK ALLEY- NIGHT (PRESENT) Butch takes out a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there were other factors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Factors that weren't clear to me until now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. - 16TH PRECINT/OFFICE- DAY An office of empty chairs and desks. Through the windows we can see the hustle and bustle of the precinct. SPECIAL AGENT GUNTHER MOONAN, still dressed in the same shitty suit, sits behind a desk as Rottovich and Sobozinski enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentlemen?   Special Agent Gunther Moonan. Moonan quickly flashes a badge and his best Kodak smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Special Agent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are Officer Richard Rottovich. And this would be Officer Walter Sobozinski. I'm looking for Jake Vig.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been looking for this Jake Vig for some time now. Problem is, the guy's the invisible man. A spook, a spectre, a ghost. Then, like a gift, Jake's good buddy and member of his crew, Alfonse Moorely, is found the other day with a hole in his head. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Moonan holds up crime scene photos of Big Al's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Preliminary forensics suggests he was. Sitting there, bloated and purple in his egg foo young for at least seventy two hours. Alfonse was not a small man and there was a lot of food ordered, so you can imagine the smell. Bad for the neighbors, good for me because in all the time I've been looking for Jake, this is only the second time I've even gotten a whiff of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look Special Agent Moonan... We don't know what you're talking about. Moonan takes out a microcassette recorder and hits PLAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O. from tape) Don't be an idiot. How hard do you think it is to sell one drug dealer's drugs to another drug dealer? If Vig's right, we might be looking at a hundred, maybe a hundred fifty grand. CLICK.   Moonan kills the recorder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah, I almost forgot. The two serious looking gentlemen outside? Internal Affairs. The Officers look out the window to see TWO SERIOUS LOOKING MEN in suits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to know the first time I had a line on Vig? He sent me a birthday card. (off their silence) Belated, but it's the thought, right? Oh, this prick's got a sense of humor. But, then again you guys probably know him better than I do. In fact, I've only met the guy once. But now, now I have you. The next best thing. His partners. His "Fix."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You help me catch him. Whatever he's into next, I want you to be into. And what you're into, I'm into. If it all goes well, those two guys from IAD will never have to hear this tape. I'll clear you guys of anything you've ever done with Vig under the guise of some cross-departmental investigation. This prick's been on the wish list for so long, you'll probably get gold shields out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you get out of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peace of mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it?
direction.name: direction
